intro: Eumachia astrellantha, commonly known as the star-leaved eumachia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped leaves that are often covered in a soft, velvety texture. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals that bloom in clusters. Eumachia astrellantha is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
